name: lucidly
content:

in a way that is clearly expressed and easy to understand: The chapters are all clearly structured and lucidly written. She argues lucidly and persuasively. See
lucid
More examplesFewer examples The key to The Review's success is its editors' ability to get remarkable writers, many of them specialists in their fields, to write lucidly for lay readers on an enormous range of complex subjects.Lucidly, she reveals how Ashoke and Ashima cope with a life away from their homeland. Express yourself lucidly and refrain from using words which may annoy or hurt your life partner.Clients describe the firm’s work as truly outstanding in terms of its ability to prepare and present extremely complicated cases lucidly and persuasively.
